questions.question: Which UNESCO World Heritage Site in Southeast Asia, known for its intricate bas-reliefs and vast temple complex, was originally constructed as a Hindu temple but later transformed into a Buddhist center?
questions.context: Angkor Wat is the largest religious monument in the world, built in the early 12th century by King Suryavarman II.

questions.question: Which modern architectural marvel, located in the Middle East, is recognized as the tallest structure constructed in the 21st century?

answer.label: Burj Khalifa, Dubai, United Arab Emirates

questions.context: Standing at 828 meters, the Burj Khalifa held its grand opening in January 2010 and features unique design elements inspired by the Hymenocallis flower.

questions.question: Identify the historical battle site in Europe where a famous battle took place in 1815, marking the end of the Napoleonic Wars.
questions.context: The Battle of Waterloo saw the defeat of Napoleon Bonaparte by a coalition of British, Dutch, Belgian, and Prussian forces.

questions.question: Which famous museum, located in Spain, is home to the largest collection of works by Pablo Picasso, including 'Guernica'?
questions.context: The Museo Reina Sofía was inaugurated in 1992 and features a diverse collection of 20th-century art pieces.

questions.question: What ancient ruin site in the Middle East was recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage Site for its rock-cut architecture and water conduit system, flourishing in the 4th century BC?
questions.context: Also known as the 'Rose City' due to the color of the stone, Petra was the capital of the Nabataean Kingdom.
